events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on the highway causing significant damage to the front bumper and engine.
The claim was reviewed and categorized as an Auto Accident based on the description of the vehicle collision incident.
An insurance agent was assigned to this case to assist the claimant through the auto accident claim process promptly.
Acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the customer confirming receipt and initiation of the auto accident insurance process.
Requested detailed photographs of vehicle damage, police report, and repair estimates from the claimant for further assessment.
The customer provided all requested documentation including photos of the accident site, damage reports, and official police documentation.
An investigation into the vehicle collision circumstances and liability was initiated based on provided evidence and reports.
Investigation concluded that the incident was caused by a third-party driver who was at fault in the car accident.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering full repairs and rental vehicle expenses due to the fault of the other driver.
The customer responded positively expressing satisfaction with the settlement proposal and prompt communication.
The claim was formally approved confirming coverage of all vehicle damage repair and related costs as per policy terms.
Payment was issued to the repair shop and customer for rental car expenses, completing the financial part of the claim.
The claim file was officially closed after all procedures were completed and the customerâ€™s satisfaction was confirmed.
The case was archived in the system for record-keeping and future reference following claim closure.
